26834036E85B4942A07ED501A0CCC84B.description: develop personal and collective visions of national identity

3803C7E6C4F449D0B8D7EF4A84E4B498.description: evaluate various perspectives of future visions of Canada (pluralism, multination model, separatism, Aboriginal self-determination, global leadership, North American integration)

8D35B067EEEE48B3B6A6E7BDD1BC3FCB.description: evaluate the challenges and opportunities associated with the promotion of Canadian national unity (Québec sovereignty, federal-provincial-territorial relations, Aboriginal self-determination and land claims, bilingualism, multiculturalism)

B2DC8DB334A34A728BB00FD3AADF8959.description: examine historical perspectives of Canada as a nation (Louis LaFontaine and Robert Baldwin, the Fathers of Con federation, First Nations treaties and the Indian Act, Métis and Inuit self-governance, Louis Riel, Sir Clifford Sifton, Henri Bourassa, French-Canadian nationalism, Pierre Trudeau, National Indian Brotherhood)

826F0CB61A0E4CBBB4B3D01FBD6EAD20.description: analyze methods used by individuals, groups and governments in Canada to promote a national identity (symbolism, mythology, institutions, government programs and initiatives)

88E4886EA3054DB1AEF61788D5BB6E38.description: explore multiple perspectives on national identity in Canada

5C5712A39CEF4E8C9195DD8B03A50C55.description: respect the views of others on alternative visions of national identity

10A92C4678CE40A5B4CAE4C9FF066FFC.description: appreciate contrasting historical and contemporary narratives associated with national identity

56047ADB754349F6B499602586C82B90.description: appreciate historical and contemporary attempts to develop a national identity

EA1FDB09FB274680BE669D693F3DB720.description: Students will assess strategies for negotiating the complexities of nationalism within the Canadian context.

E667C2C743BD477CB1C041F8AD31379A.description: To what extent should individuals and groups in Canada embrace a national identity?

AAFE8EC3CADC4C05BC0EF39BCEF2D1D1.description: evaluate the extent to which nationalism must be sacrificed in the interest of internationalism

BD9001C1238F45C48453D7638A675FC5.description: analyze impacts of the pursuit of internationalism in addressing contemporary global issues (conflict, poverty, debt, disease, environment, human rights)

020FBF236A414327A737FE545433DAFC.description: evaluate the extent to which selected organizations promote internationalism (United Nations, World Council of Indigenous Peoples, European Union, l'Organisation internationale de la Francophonie, Arctic Council, contemporary examples)

2119E668533B410E83DAB07B4187989D.description: analyze how internationalism can be promoted through foreign policy (multilateralism, supranationalism, peacekeeping, foreign aid, international law and agreements)

3693D176BFC54A7BBD47230AA47F20F5.description: analyze the motives of nation and state involvement or noninvolvement in international affairs (economic stability, self-determination, peace, security, humanitarianism)

B7DBD98759BA4AFA952027DAEC905036.description: demonstrate a global consciousness with respect to the human condition and global affairs

AD4AC0EAD3D24B25A6740776114D1F6D.description: appreciate the impacts of nation and state involvement in regional and global affairs on individual and collective identities

EEF6398879334B9CAED33B68052E2D49.description: appreciate that nations and states engage in regional and global affairs for a variety of reasons

81E6609D9C6B4D5584E1F7D19E53EF81.description: Students will assess impacts of the pursuit of internationalism in contemporary global affairs.

A10CD3EA2EDA4CC7988ACC634ECEF620.description: To what extent should internationalism be pursued?

6C224322F241430295D458F824ED6CE7.description: analyze impacts of the pursuit of national self-determination (successor states; decolonization; Québecois nationalism and sovereignty movement; First Nations, Métis and Inuit self-government; contemporary examples)

0F456D5C1D8E48B79364D7EE678987AE.description: analyze ultranationalism as a cause of genocide (the Holocaust, 1932-1933 famine in Ukraine, contemporary examples)

D5EC0AD4E43F42699F128DEB4BEA7123.description: analyze nationalism and ultranationalism during times of conflict (causes of the First and Second World Wars, examples of nationalism and ultranationalism from the First and Second World Wars, ultranationalism in Japan, internments in Canada, conscription crises)

737FCFB7375344639361DA94EAF99689.description: analyze the relationship between nationalism and ultranationalism

AA1D9FCC7F12456698AD55DA376365A0.description: analyze how the pursuit of national interest shapes foreign policy (First World War peace settlements, the interwar period)

9B6FD51E6D724A3DA164EA274506D913.description: explore the relationship between nationalism and the pursuit of national interest

B8D3462886C64795859E6C8827A2D768.description: appreciate multiple perspectives related to the pursuit of national interest

84C4F540CB2A42C7B177810E363A81B1.description: appreciate that the pursuit of national interest has positive and negative consequences

D4CD3D7D2A9146BEB7E9CDE3097E4149.description: appreciate that nations and states pursue national interest

21D7088D159F470F87B925D6DA3CFF09.description: Students will assess impacts of nationalism, ultranationalism and the pursuit of national interest.

9C1855B65466499297DD1328B33CF451.description: To what extent should national interest be pursued?

2FFA29159C584D04A383A73562653E71.description: evaluate the importance of reconciling nationalism with contending non-nationalist loyalties (religion, region, culture, race, ideology, class, other contending loyalties)

FC45A086CD304DDB89741A205C569772.description: evaluate the importance of reconciling contending nationalist loyalties (Canadian nationalism, First Nations and Métis nationalism, ethnic nationalism in Canada, civic nationalism in Canada, Québecois nationalism, Inuit perspectives on nationalism)

DB2BD2664F4848BC9A939B152CFAC90E.description: analyze nationalism as an identity, internalized feeling and/or collective consciousness shared by a people (French Revolution and Napoleonic era, Canadian nationalism, Québecois nationalism, American nationalism, First Nations and Métis nationalism, Inuit perspectives)

47FF01A36E7E4183A5FA7A59D9208382.description: analyze how the development of nationalism is shaped by historical, geographic, political, economic and social factors (French Revolution and Napoleonic era, contemporary examples)

4ADF4B63F9F741F18FB7343B9CB3C9E7.description: analyze the relationship between nation and nation-state

9BD92FE2589D41B3AC87471110EF763B.description: develop understandings of nation and nationalism (relationship to land, geographic, collective, civic, ethnic, cultural, linguistic, political, spiritual, religious, patriotic)

B5AB9F9393E2432BAF09C7C6C0EC0A39.description: explore a range of expressions of nationalism

15A60DE8682746B89794DC3EE8E0C0EE.description: appreciate why peoples seek to promote their identity through nationalism

27E496D769F84059B6EF48FB4078642D.description: appreciate how the forces of nationalism have shaped, and continue to shape, Canada and the world

8BC34FA7EB004767A38D5DB6D71F93A3.description: appreciate the existence of alternative views on the meaning of nation

7564E18CD62B4D5AB3DE94BA73FD956C.description: appreciate that understandings of identity, nation and nationalism continue to evolve

CBD766DD5A434485B741B465FABAE742.description: Students will explore the relationships among identity, nation and nationalism.

153C0E5A2FC24C20B2F550E0D2F6E53B.description: To what extent should nation be the foundation of identity?

58532CF705B54DB5A69515504ABA9FCC.description: Students will understand, assess and respond to the complexities of nationalism.

03795A45C424451A9715D2E9C768AEC0.description: To what extent should we embrace nationalism?
